item.title: Jio and Star to operate as unified entity from India-England series - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Jio and Star to Operate as Unified Entity from India-England Series

Published on: Mon, Dec 23, 2024, 05:16 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

With the completion of the mega-merger between Jio and Star, the two sports broadcasting giants will start operating as a unified entity during the England tour of India.

  • The merger allows for cross-promotion of properties across platforms.
  • The England series will be broadcast live on Star Sports and Disney+ Hotstar, along with original platforms like JioCinema.
  • The transaction of the joint venture was worth INR 70.352 crore (USD 8.5 billion).
  • Reliance Industries invested Rs 11,500 crore (1.4 billion) into the venture.
  • Star Sports remains a leading sports channel in India but has faced competition from rivals like Sports18 and JioCinema.
“The merger of the media and JioCinema businesses of Viacom18 into Star India Private Limited (SIPL) has become effective.” - Reliance Industries Limited

This integration marks a new era in sports broadcasting in India, potentially reshaping how cricket and other sports are presented to the audience.

item.title: "Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...": Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Ser.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...: Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Series In Australia

Publication Date: September 22, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian cricket star Ravichandran Ashwin surprised fans by announcing his retirement from international cricket after the third Test against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Ashwin, the highest wicket-taker among active bowlers, retired with two Tests remaining in the series.
  • His decision to retire was questioned by former players like Sunil Gavaskar.
  • In an interview, Ashwin expressed his need to not hold onto things and emphasized his belief in leaving without celebration or attention.
  • He reflected on his love for the game and his journey, highlighting that he has no regrets regarding his career.
“I’ve got no regrets because I’ve had to do it the hard way, but it has left me with the idea that the game has been my calling.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin's retirement marks the end of a significant chapter in Indian cricket, affecting fans and the team as they adapt to his absence.

item.title: Vinod Kambli diagnosed with 'clots in brain' in worrying health update; hospital provides life-long free treatment - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Diagnosed with Brain Clots; Hospital Offers Free Treatment

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Vinod Kambli, former Indian cricketer, has been diagnosed with clots in his brain after being admitted to the hospital following a health decline over the weekend. The hospital has committed to providing him with lifelong free treatment.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital due to urinary infection and cramps.
  • Doctors found clots in his brain after conducting examinations.
  • The hospital's medical in-charge announced lifelong free treatment for Kambli.
  • Kambli suffered a previous collapse due to health issues about a month ago.
  • Concerns from cricket legends like Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar regarding his health were noted.
"I was suffering from a urine problem... My head started spinning; I collapsed and fell down." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli's health situation is being closely monitored, and he is receiving additional medical examinations as needed.

item.title: 'Don't cry because its over': Heartfelt sentiments from R Ashwin with the Indian flag as the backdrop - The Times of India
item.description:
'Don't cry because its over': Heartfelt sentiments from R Ashwin with the Indian flag as the backdrop

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

India's premier off-spinner, R Ashwin, announced his retirement from international cricket while reflecting on his journey, expressing gratitude and fond memories.

  • Ashwin retired mid-series against Australia, marking the end of a storied international career.
  • He is India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, with 537 wickets.
  • The farewell photo featured a smiling Ashwin with the Indian national flag in the background.
  • Despite his retirement, he affirmed he still has cricket left in him.
  • Ashwin's career spanned various formats, amassing significant wicket totals in ODIs and T20Is as well.
“Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.”

R Ashwin's retirement emphasizes the end of an era for Indian cricket, celebrated for his skill, intellect, and contributions to the game.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: "Clots In Brain": On Vinod Kambli's Urgent Hospitalisation, Doctor Gives Worrying Details - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Hospitalized Due to Brain Clots: Doctor Provides Update

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Vinod Kambli, the former India cricketer, has been hospitalized with brain clots following initial complaints of a urinary infection. Doctors have reported that his condition remains critical but stable.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital in Thane after experiencing urinary issues and cramps.
  • Medical examinations revealed clots in his brain; ongoing monitoring and further tests are scheduled.
  • Dr. Vivek Trivedi stated that Kambli's health is being closely observed.
  • Life-long free treatment has been pledged by the hospital in-charge, S Singh.
  • Kambli's recent health struggles have gained public attention, particularly due to viral videos showing his condition.
Kambli said, "I am better now. My wife takes care of me a lot... My son picked me up and brought me back to my feet."

The situation remains serious as doctors continue to monitor Kambli's health, and further updates are anticipated.

item.title: "Not Able To Do The Job": Cheteshwar Pujara's Unfiltered Dig At India Duo Ahead of Boxing Day Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Not Able To Do The Job: Cheteshwar Pujara's Unfiltered Dig At India Duo Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Cheteshwar Pujara expresses concerns over the Indian bowling attack's ability to take 20 wickets in Tests ahead of the critical Boxing Day Test against Australia, emphasizing the team's need for improvement in their bowling depth and top-order batting performance.

  • Pujara questions the current effectiveness of India’s bowling attack, particularly their fourth and fifth bowlers.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, with crucial matches in Melbourne and Sydney ahead.
  • Concerns about the top-order batting alongside the bowling dilemma, with specific reference to Mitchell Starc's outstanding performance.
  • Pujara criticizes the lack of support for Jasprit Bumrah and the need for a stronger team composition.
Pujara stated, "To win a Test match, you have to take 20 wickets, and the ability to take 20 wickets is not that good."

Overall, Pujara emphasizes the need for strategic adjustments in both bowling and batting if India aims to secure victory in the remaining Test matches.

item.title: Kuldeep Yadav doubtful for Champions Trophy, inclusion for England series under threat - CricTracker
item.description:
Kuldeep Yadav Doubtful for Champions Trophy as Recovery Continues

Date: October 2023

Source: CricTracker

The Indian cricket team is preparing for the Champions Trophy 2025 but faces uncertainty with star spinner Kuldeep Yadav's upcoming participation due to a groin injury.

  • India is set to participate in the Champions Trophy in February 2025, hosted by UAE and Pakistan.
  • Kuldeep Yadav is recovering from a groin injury and recent surgery, limiting his chances for selection in upcoming matches against England.
  • His coach remains hopeful of his early return to training and potential inclusion in the Champions Trophy.
“Kuldeep is yet to start bowling... it’s not impossible but tough (for Kuldeep to return) as just over a month remains for those games to begin.”

The situation regarding Kuldeep's fitness is critical as the tournament approaches, with his coach optimistic about his chances of recovery in time for the Champions Trophy.

item.title: Tanush Kotian to join India squad; Shami deemed unfit - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Tanush Kotian Joins India Squad as Shami Remains Unfit

Publication Date: Mon, Dec 23, 2024, 01:04 PM

Source: Cricbuzz

Tanush Kotian, a promising offspinning all-rounder from Mumbai, is set to join India’s squad for the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy after Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement announcement.

  • Kotian is expected to arrive in Melbourne ahead of the third Test.
  • He has been a key player in Mumbai's cricket scenes, especially in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Statistics: Kotian has played 33 first-class games, scoring 1525 runs and taking 101 wickets.
  • Shami has been ruled unfit to play due to a knee issue, hampering his return to international cricket.
  • Shami's progress will be closely monitored by the BCCI Medical Team for future matches.
“Shami experienced swelling in his left knee due to bowling workload, indicating he is not ready for selection.”

This move represents a significant shift in the team as they prepare for the high-stakes matches ahead.

item.title: Breaking: Arjun Erigaisi gets US visa, to fly tonight for World Rapid and Blitz - The Indian Express
item.description:
Arjun Erigaisi Secures US Visa for World Rapid and Blitz Championship

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 - Source: The Indian Express

After a nerve-wracking wait over the past week, Arjun Erigaisi has received his US visa to compete at the World Rapid and Blitz Championship on Wall Street in New York. He confirmed this development via text message and plans to fly to New York later tonight.

  • Arjun's participation is vital for his standing in the FIDE Circuit, where he is currently trailing Fabiano Caruana by six points.
  • The upcoming tournament offers significant points for the FIDE Circuit 2024 race, crucial for the Candidates tournament qualification.
  • Arjun currently holds 124.40 points, while Caruana leads with 132.42 points after winning the Saint Louis Masters.
  • The championship will be held from December 26 to 31, featuring top players like Magnus Carlsen and Hikaru Nakamura.
“The World Rapid and Blitz Championship may not be a classical world championship but it’s still a World Championship. It’s very prestigious. Besides, if I do well there I will have the chance to qualify for the Candidates tournament.” - Arjun Erigaisi

In conclusion, securing the visa allows Arjun to focus on his preparation for a crucial stage in his chess career, aiming for a spot in the prestigious Candidates tournament.

item.title: Pat Cummins story: The Aussie in habit of turning lemons into lemonade - The Indian Express
item.description:
The Journey of Pat Cummins: Turning Challenges into Success

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Pat Cummins, Australian cricket captain, has faced numerous challenges throughout his career, from injuries to personal crises, but he has consistently turned these adversities into opportunities for growth and success.

  • Cummins experienced a heartfelt moment before the 2021 Ashes, contemplating his newborn son.
  • As a child, he suffered a finger injury that affected his bowling style but did not deter his passion for cricket.
  • After a promising debut, Cummins faced injuries that caused him to restructure his approach to the game with mentoring from legends.
  • His experiences include a significant weight loss episode during a Bangladesh tour, which motivated him to prioritize fitness.
  • During the COVID-19 pandemic, he dealt with his mother's cancer diagnosis, leading to personal growth and reflection.
  • He faced public criticism over his environmental stance as a captain, which led to him founding 'Cricket for Climate'.
“I learned a few things about the impermanence of life and the importance of each day.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Cummins exemplifies resilience, utilizing every crisis as a stepping stone for personal and professional development in his cricketing journey.

item.title: Shami ruled out of remaining two Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Mohammed Shami Ruled Out of Remaining Two Tests in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami has been ruled out of the fourth and fifth Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to swelling in his left knee, as per a BCCI press release.

  • Shami recently played for Bengal and had a busy schedule leading up to the Tests.
  • His knee swelling is attributed to increased workload from recent bowling activities.
  • The BCCI medical team recommends more time for recovery before he can return to play.
“The swelling is on the expected lines, owing to the increased bowling after a prolonged period.”

Shami has been recovering from a heel injury and will continue strength and conditioning work. His participation in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy will depend on his knee condition.

item.title: Who is Tanush Kotian? R Ashwin's replacement for India vs Australia series - The Times of India
item.description:
Who is Tanush Kotian? R Ashwin's Replacement for India vs Australia Series

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Tanush Kotian, an all-rounder from Mumbai, is set to join the Indian cricket team as a potential replacement for Ravichandran Ashwin ahead of the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

  • Kotian has been instructed to prepare for a departure to Australia.
  • He recently impressed during his tour with the India A team.
  • Kotian performed notably at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, scoring 44 runs batting at No. 8.
  • He is currently participating in the Vijay Hazare Trophy with Mumbai.
  • Kotian won 'Player of the Tournament' in the Ranji Trophy, contributing to Mumbai's 42nd title.
  • His first-class statistics include 2523 runs and 101 wickets across 33 matches.
“His consistent performance in domestic cricket has propelled him into contention for a spot in the national team.”

The inclusion of Tanush Kotian marks a significant development in his career and highlights his rising profile in Indian cricket.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Y.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team has selected young Mumbai off-spinner Tanush Kotian to replace Ravichandran Ashwin, who announced his retirement following the third Test in Brisbane.

  • Tanush Kotian has played 33 First Class matches, taking 101 wickets.
  • Kotian has been included as a precautionary measure and will travel to Australia.
  • Originally, Axar Patel was considered for the replacement but opted out due to personal reasons.
  • Ashwin retired as India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket.
"I made myself a promise in 2012, we lost a tricky series against England. I was very early in my career and I was just telling myself we are not gonna lose another one. Ever. And that is what I promised myself," said Ashwin.

The addition of Kotian underscores the Indian team's strategy to maintain squad strength following Ashwin's retirement.

item.title: Horner opens up on Perez’s exit from Red Bull as he says it was Mexican’s decision to ‘take time out’ - Formula 1
item.description:
Christian Horner Discusses Sergio Perez’s Decision to Leave Red Bull

Date: November 14, 2024 | Source: Formula 1

Christian Horner has provided insight into Sergio Perez’s exit from Red Bull Racing, explaining that the decision was made by Perez himself as he takes time to reflect on his future decisions.

  • Perez had been struggling with performance after a strong start to the 2024 season.
  • Despite having a contract extension, Perez and Red Bull agreed to part ways.
  • Liam Lawson is set to replace Perez as Max Verstappen’s teammate in 2025.
  • Horner emphasizes Perez’s positive contributions to the team, including his role in previous championships.
  • Perez ended the season eighth in the drivers' championship, significantly behind Verstappen.
“We’re sad to see him leave the team, but obviously it’s time for him to spend with his young family as well and reflect on what he wants to do for the future.” - Christian Horner

This exit marks a significant change for Red Bull, with the team now looking ahead to the 2025 season without Perez.

item.title: Watch: $300 At Stake As Sarfaraz Khan Captains Virat Kohli Ahead Of Boxing Day Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sarfaraz Khan Leads Team India in Fun Fielding Drill Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: NDTV

Ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia, Team India participated in an engaging fielding drill with a prize of 300 dollars at stake. The third Test ended in a draw, making the series tied at 1-1.

  • India's fielding coach T Dilip explained the target hitting system with three stumps.
  • Key objective was to energize the team before net practice.
  • Dhruv Jurel's group won the cash prize for the drill.
“Target hitting with points system. 3 groups led by young captains. Cash reward on the line. Fun, energy and intensity - #TeamIndia gears up for the Melbourne Test with a lively fielding drill with Fielding coach T Dilip,” BCCI announced.

The Boxing Day Test is set to commence on December 26 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

item.title: Indian chess GM Tania Sachdev slams authorities for lack of recognition in hard-hitting post: ‘Sadly, Delhi has yet to…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian Chess GM Tania Sachdev Calls for Greater Recognition from Delhi Government

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartfelt social media post, Women's Grandmaster Tania Sachdev expressed disappointment at the lack of recognition for chess players in Delhi, especially in light of recent successes in Indian chess.

  • Tania Sachdev criticizes the Delhi government's lack of support for chess achievers.
  • Highlights disparity in recognition compared to Gukesh's celebration in Tamil Nadu.
  • Emphasizes her achievements, including a historic bronze in the 2022 Chess Olympiad.
  • Calls on Delhi officials to value and support their chess athletes.
“Having played for India since 2008, it’s disheartening to see a lack of recognition from the Delhi government for achievements in chess.” - Tania Sachdev

Sachdev's impassioned plea seeks to inspire the government to celebrate and support chess achievements in Delhi, similar to other states in India.

item.title: Mumbai all-rounder Tanush Kotian to join India squad ahead of Melbourne Test - Sportstar
item.description:
Mumbai All-Rounder Tanush Kotian Joins India Squad Ahead of Melbourne Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Hindu

Tanush Kotian, an impressive off-spinning all-rounder from Mumbai, is set to join the Indian cricket squad for the upcoming Melbourne Test.

  • Kotian has been performing exceptionally in the Indian domestic circuit.
  • He was a member of the India A team that toured Australia recently.
  • His inclusion comes as part of the preparations for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
"Kotian has been one of the best off-spinning all-rounders in the Indian domestic circuit."

Kotian's addition to the squad reflects India's commitment to bolster their team with talented individuals ahead of a crucial series.

item.title: PV Sindhu and Venkat Datta make first public appearance as married couple in stunning ethnic attire: Pics - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PV Sindhu and Venkat Datta's Stunning First Appearance as a Married Couple

Date: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Badminton champion PV Sindhu and entrepreneur Venkat Datta made their first appearance in glam ethnic looks as a married couple in Hyderabad after tying the knot in Udaipur.

  • The couple tied the knot on December 22 in an intimate ceremony in Udaipur, Rajasthan.
  • Sindhu wore a bright orange Anarkali suit with intricate white embroidery and a matching Bandhani-print dupatta.
  • Venkat Datta paired a white kurta with a purple bandhani-printed waistcoat.
  • They spoke about their love for family traditions and upcoming wedding reception events.
“We both love celebrating festivals, and family traditions are incredibly important to us.”

The couple celebrated their wedding in a private ceremony and plans to continue their family traditions with joy.

item.title: Vinod Kambli admitted to Thane hospital in critical condition - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Admitted to Thane Hospital in Critical Condition

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, has been hospitalized in Thane and is reported to be in critical condition. His health has raised concerns among fans and the cricket community.

  • Kambli has been experiencing severe health issues recently.
  • The exact cause of his critical condition has not been publicly disclosed.
  • Fans and former teammates have expressed their support and concern on social media.
"We are all praying for his speedy recovery." - A former teammate

This incident has highlighted the importance of health awareness among athletes.

item.title: The puzzle around shooter Manu Bhaker's name missing from Khel Ratna list, now NRAI contacts Sports Minis - The Times of India
item.description:
Controversy Over Manu Bhaker's Absence from Khel Ratna Award List

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Times of India

The National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) has contacted the Sports Ministry after noticing that shooter Manu Bhaker's name was omitted from the prestigious Khel Ratna award list, raising questions about the selection process.

  • The NRAI is concerned about the absence of Manu Bhaker from the Khel Ratna awards.
  • Bhaker is a prominent shooter with various accolades to her name.
  • The issue brings to light potential flaws in the recognition system for athletes.
“We have made a formal request to the Sports Ministry to address this oversight.” - NRAI Official

This situation highlights the challenges faced by athletes in receiving due recognition for their accomplishments, stirring discussions among sports enthusiasts.
